statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

video.headline: SMU Rolls Past Memphis
video.caption: ESPN's Doris Burke and Dave O'Brien discussed SMU's 73-59 victory over the Memphis Tigers.
video.description: ESPN's Doris Burke and Dave O'Brien discussed SMU's 73-59 victory over the Memphis Tigers.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Analysis (SMU Rolls Past Memphis) 2015/01/08 ESHEET Event Postgame

video.title: SMU Rolls Past Memphis

article.headline: Kennedy scores 21, SMU beats Memphis 73-59

images.name: SMU Rolls Past Memphis
images.caption: ESPN's Doris Burke and Dave O'Brien discussed SMU's 73-59 victory over the Memphis Tigers.

article.story:
DALLAS -- Markus Kennedy scored 21 points on 10-of-13 shooting to lead Southern Methodist to a 73-59 victory over Memphis on Thursday night.

SMU (11-4, 2-1 American Athletic Conference) bounced back after having its eight-game winning streak snapped by Cincinnati, 56-50 on Jan. 3.

Yanick Moreira had 15 points, and Ben Moore and Keith Frazier each chipped in 12 points for the Mustangs, who shot 27 of 52 from the field for 51.9 percent and outrebounded the Tigers 38-22. Nic Moore added eight points and eight assists for the Mustangs.

SMU had a 34-21 halftime advantage, and Frazier's layup with 9:14 to play stretched the Mustangs' lead to 53-42, and they led by double digits the rest of the way.

Austin Nichols scored 11 points and D'Marnier Cunningham 10 to lead Memphis (8-6, 1-2).
